Food & Culinary Arts.name: Spice Rack Showdown
Food & Culinary Arts.description: Test your knowledge of herbs, spices, and kosher dietary laws! This quiz explores the nuances of flavor and tradition in the culinary world.

questions.text: Which of these is not a spice?
questions.hint: This is a vegetable, often used in salads, not a seasoning.

questions.text: Which of these foods is not traditionally considered kosher?
questions.hint: This food is forbidden in Jewish dietary laws due to its lack of fins and scales.

questions.text: Which of these is not a type of chili pepper?
questions.hint: This name is a city, not a pepper variety, unlike the others.

questions.text: What is the name of the fruit that is half tangerine and half grapefruit?
questions.hint: The name is a blend of the two parent fruits, starting with 'tang.'

questions.text: Which of these foods is poisonous to dogs?

questions.text: In what restaurant can you order a Grand Slam breakfast?

questions.text: In America, what is the main ingredient in pepperoni?

questions.text: Cheese is a necessary ingredient in which of these dishes?

questions.text: A pita is a type of what?

questions.text: Which of these dishes is made from pig intestines?

Food & Culinary Arts.description: Sausage-wrapped pancakes? Opium-laced poppy seeds? This quiz explores the quirky and surprising side of breakfast traditions worldwide.

questions.text: What's the popular name of the breakfast meal consisting of sausages wrapped in pancakes?

questions.hint: This food comes from a seed associated with a flower linked to opiates.

questions.text: What tea is known for its distinctive bergamot flavor?

questions.hint: This vegetable is a root, unlike the others, which are pod-bearing plants.

questions.text: The term 'chili con carne' refers to chili with what?

questions.text: Which of these is not found in a Snickers candy bar?
questions.hint: Snickers uses peanuts, not this other type of nut.
